casebody.data:
JAMES D. FOWLER, and another, Plaintiffs and Respondents v. JOHN KELLY, Defendant and Appellant.

Before Curtis, Ch. J., Sedgwick and Speir, JJ.

Decided May 8, 1877. Appeal from judgment entered on verdict for plaintiff. The only point involved was as to whether the evidence was such as not to uphold the verdict. Robert S. Green, for appellant. H. Daily, Jr., for respondent. Sedgwick, J.,

wrote for affirmance with costs.

Curtis, Ch. J., and Speir, J., concurred.
